problem: What is $\dbinom{n}{n-1}$ for any positive integer $n$?  (Answer in terms of $n$.)
solution:
\begin{align*}
\dbinom{n}{n-1}&=\dfrac{n!}{(n-1)!~1!}\\
&=\dfrac{n\times(n-1)\times(n-2)\times(n-3)\times\cdots\times 2\times 1}{(n-1)\times (n-2)\times (n-3)\times \cdots \times 2\times 1}\\
&=\boxed{n}.
\end{align*}Also, $\binom{n}{n-1}$ is the number of ways to choose $n-1$ objects out of $n$.  This is equivalent to choosing $1$ object not to use.  Since there are $n$ different objects, there are $\boxed{n}$ ways to do this.
model_solution:
Step 1: Write the expression for $\dbinom{n}{n-1}$ using the definition of combinations: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=\dfrac{n!}{(n-1)!(n-(n-1))!}$.
Step 2: Simplify the expression for $\dbinom{n}{n-1}$ by canceling out common factors in the numerator and denominator: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=\dfrac{n!}{(n-1)!\cdot 1!}$
Step 3: Simplify the expression for $\dbinom{n}{n-1}$ by canceling out common factors in the numerator and denominator: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=\dfrac{n\cdot (n-1)!}{(n-1)! \cdot 1!}$.
Step 4: Cancel out the common factor in the numerator and the denominator, $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=\dfrac{n}{1!}$
Step 5: Simplify $\dfrac{n}{1!}$ by evaluating the factorial in the denominator: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=n$
Step 6: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=n$
Step 7: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=n$
Step 8: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=n$
Step 9: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=n$
Step 10: $\dbinom{n}{n-1}=n$
